question: Which country celebrates "Vappu Festival"
explanation: Vappu Festival is celebrated annually on May 1st and marks the end of Winter. It is also celebrated as International Labour Day and is one of the biggest festivals of the year in Finland alongside Midsummer's Day and Christmas. The Finnish name Vappu originates from an 8th-century German saint called Walpurgis, who has canonized on May 1st 870 AD.
